TopicTitle: What would you like to see on kerbin?

Articles.Content:
What would you like to see on kerbin, things such as cities and stuff.

For me I would say airports (I think it would be hilarious bumping a big jet aircraft out the way while I land my SSTO on their runway) and some big radio telescopes like the one at Jodrell Bank in UK.
Towns, cities, Kerbals going about their day to day business, like shopping, working, etc.
An ocean launch platform!

Towns, cities, Kerbals going about their day to day business, like shopping, working, etc.

Kiddy kerbals building metre tall mini rockets!

A newer, better Space center, because they're going for that. But if you count things loooonngg off...

Then it'd be a nice addition if we had Lights on Kerbins, and clouds. T not make everyone's computer go ape****, I do'nt want cities with erbals, city lights with it, airports and all sorts of other stuff mixed into a lovely lagfest hell.

An ocean launch platform!

Nice idea, I didn't think of that! That'd be an AWSOME addition.

Kiddy kerbals building metre tall mini rockets!
Warning: May induce holes in aircrafts and rockets.

DeathRocket .Co is not responsible for deaths of pilots.

Edited April 30, 2013 by Munstation
City lights on the nightside, clouds, lightnings, maybe occasional aurora over the poles - just graphic fluff i guess
The, I think a slider with building detail would be in order, should such lag inducing things arrive.

An ocean launch platform!

T`would be a fine addition!

I know its not technically on the ground or involves kerbals, but I would LOVE to finally see some clouds on Kerbin. It hardly matters how Squad implements this, it can even be a flat texture that you can only see from orbit. Because Kerbin is so small, from LKO Kerbin looks weird, and clouds (and weather in general) would really improve the look of it. Maybe there could even be a improved look of atmospheres in general or some clouds on Laythe?
I want cities, so I can bring Jeb down laughing like a maniac into the center, scaring the heck outta the Kerbals living there XD

I know its not technically on the ground or involves kerbals, but I would LOVE to finally see some clouds on Kerbin. Snip . Maybe there could even be a improved look of atmospheres in general or some clouds on Laythe?

Mmmm... Polar Storms and tropical equator....

oooohhh yess... Ohhohoho that'd be sweet. And a large aurora for reasons you should know.

I would love to see clouds, Kerbin doesn't look quite as impressive from orbit compared to Earth. And lights on the night side would be AMAZING, I would definitely use the upcoming Panopticon (?) cockpit to stare at the planet from orbit for hours...

I would love to see clouds, Kerbin doesn't look quite as impressive from orbit compared to Earth. And lights on the night side would be AMAZING, I would definitely use the upcoming Panopticon (?) cockpit to stare at the planet from orbit for hours...

If the clouds induced a small wind (A small punch sideways) we should get little weather satellites. Should be toggleable.
Clouds, possibly some atmospheric effects. Lights denoting inhabited areas on the night side of the planet, but no actual cities (a la Orbiter) as I spend more time off-planet than on.
It'd also be fun to drive a rover down the streets of kertropolis while all the people look at you going "what the, I don't even know anymore...'

Yeah that would be funny.
Grand Theft Kerbal would be interesting too. Land near a city then hijack a car and drive it back to KSC.

I think my biggest Kerbal wish will be granted when i orbit Kerbin and i see city lights twinkling below, i'd love to be able to fly over those cities and even walk around in them, Kerbals could be pottering around much as they do at the space center, blimps could hang up in the air.

I'd like to see clouds and rain, possibly even storms on Kerbin, i'd also like to see small village and farming communities away from the big cities, with fields of corn etc.
Some optimization. After that, clouds, and after that some lightspots on the dark side, to look like cities.
lights on the night side,simple as.
A kraken in the oceans.

Clouds, possibly some atmospheric effects. Lights denoting inhabited areas on the night side of the planet, but no actual cities (a la Orbiter) as I spend more time off-planet than on.

This, with some kickass auroras, since I do enjoy making polar bases...
Besides from the city lights, I like to see some weather conditions e.g. wind and rain that would influence your launch. It would be awesome to set up a weather tracking station!

Who needs things like clouds to just be on Kerbin? How about something like thin, wispy clouds on Duna that are very scarce, or thick purple clouds that cover most of Eve? There could be auroras on Kerbins polar regions too, and Munstation had a good idea that there maybe even could be spectacular ones on Laythe that are caused by Jool's strong magnetic field? Rain? There are so many weather ideas
If anyone has played Il-2 Stuvmorvik i want the same type of graphics for ground objects...
